51.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
51.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

51.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
51.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

51.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
51.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

51.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
51.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

51.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
51.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

51.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
51.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

51.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
51.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

52.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
52.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

52.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
52.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

52.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
52.str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

52.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
52.str2: To search diligently, examine. Apparently from ereo; to seek, i.e. to investigate.

52.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
52.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

52.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
52.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

53.str2: Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

53.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural

53.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

53.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
